title: Market Capitalization and Valuation Metrics of Cano Health Inc Stock

content.text: As of a certain date, the market capitalization of Cano Health Inc was $X million.
Cano Health Inc's valuation can be assessed using relevant valuation ratios.
The P/E ratio of Cano Health Inc indicates the price investors are willing to pay for each dollar of earnings. A P/E ratio of X is considered high/low in the industry benchmark.
The P/S ratio of Cano Health Inc compares the stock price to the company's revenue. A P/S ratio of X is considered high/low in the industry benchmark.
The P/B ratio of Cano Health Inc compares the stock price to the company's book value per share. A P/B ratio of X is considered high/low in the industry benchmark.
The EPS of Cano Health Inc represents the company's profit allocated to each outstanding share. Cano Health Inc's EPS is $X.
The dividend yield of Cano Health Inc represents the annual dividend payout as a percentage of the stock price. Cano Health Inc has a dividend yield of X%.
Additional valuation metrics such as EV/EBITDA, Price/Cash Flow, and Price/Free Cash Flow can also be considered.

news.headline: 3 Stocks to Sell for a Clean Slate Heading Into 2024
news.summary: Let’s not sugarcoat it – the topic of stocks to sell sucks. Obviously, with any talks about removing securities from your portfolio, you’re dealing with other people’s money and their aspirations. On the other side of the table, many jobs are on the line if the target enterprise stumbles further. news.headline: Cano Health Announces Consummation of Previously-Announced 1-for-100 Reverse Stock Split
news.summary: Cano Health, Inc. ("Cano Health" or the "Company") (NYSE: CANO) today announced that it completed a 1-for-100 reverse stock split of its shares Class A common stock and Class B common stock, including both issued and outstanding and unissued shares, following approval by the Company's stockholders and its Board of Directors (the "Reverse Stock Split").
